description: Disability prevalence and employment gap data for EU/EEA countries based on the Global Activity Limitation Indicator (GALI) from EU-SILC

prevalence_data.dataset_name: Population by activity limitation status, by sex, age and income quintile
prevalence_data.source: EU Statistics on Income and Living Conditions (EU-SILC)

employment_gap.dataset_name: Disability employment gap by level of activity limitation and sex
employment_gap.source: EU Statistics on Income and Living Conditions (EU-SILC)

methodology.description: The GALI question asks respondents whether they have been limited in activities people usually do because of health problems for at least the past 6 months. Response options: severely limited, limited but not severely, not limited at all.

eu27_summary_2023.note: EU27 average for population aged 16+ (prevalence) and 20-64 (employment gap)

gali_indicator.description: Global Activity Limitation Indicator (GALI) - self-reported activity limitation due to health problems for at least the past 6 months

disability_employment_gap.description: Gap between employment rate of persons without disability and persons with disability (aged 20-64)

disability_employment_gap.description: Gap between employment rate of persons without disability and persons with disability (aged 20-64)

notes: All prevalence data expressed as percentage of population aged 16 or over
Employment gap expressed in percentage points: employment rate of non-disabled minus employment rate of disabled (aged 20-64)
GALI = Global Activity Limitation Indicator, the standard EU measure of disability
Data from EU-SILC (EU Statistics on Income and Living Conditions)
Income quintiles based on equivalized disposable income
Most country data is from 2023; Luxembourg from 2022; Iceland from 2020
